newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL-Citrix up on Microsoft deal.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL-Citrix up on Microsoft deal.

text.p: Shares of Citrix Systems Inc traded higher in U.S. pre-opening action Monday after the company said it had signed a pact for Microsoft Corp to license its multiuser server technology.
Citrix shares sold at 24-1/2, up 5-1/4 from their Friday close at 19-1/4, traders said.

Dynamics Corp of America was bid at 51, up from its Friday close at 44-3/8. Dynamics and CTS Corp said they had agreed to merge. Under the pact, CTS would tender for about 50 percent of Dyanics's stock at $55 per share.
Each Dynamic share not purchased in the tender would be converted into 0.88 share of CTS.

AutoImmune Inc traded at 4-3/8, down 1/16 from its Friday close. AutoImmune said two Phase II trials of its Colloral oral treatment for rheumatoid arthritis were positive but did not demonstrate statistical significance against a placebo.
The company said more development likely was needed before Phase III trials.
